intro: Heliotropium biannulatum, commonly known as the two-year heliotrope, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, violet to purple flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
